name: Tournament Design Before Implementation
description: Before implementing any UI/UX design, run a full tournament: two brackets each produce a finalist through internal competition, then finalists compete for champion. Duro learns which approaches win.

phase_0_plan.action: Plan the project comprehensively - architecture, features, user flows

phase_1_bracket_a.name: Bracket A: Energetic
phase_1_bracket_a.action: Create two directions from energetic family (playful_sports, bold_vibrant)

phase_2_bracket_b.name: Bracket B: Refined
phase_2_bracket_b.action: Create two directions from refined family (minimal_clean, dark_premium)

phase_3_finals.name: Championship
phase_3_finals.action: Finalist 1 vs Finalist 2 - evaluate and declare champion or blend

phase_4_learn.name: Learn
phase_4_learn.action: Log tournament results, update bracket/direction win rates, identify patterns
tracks: What criteria scores correlated with winning?
Was final a blend or clear winner?

phase_5_implement.action: Implement the champion design in code

exceptions: User explicitly requests to skip tournament
Single-component additions to existing design system
rationale: Tournament structure forces exploration of fundamentally different design philosophies. Each bracket produces its best work, then those compete. Over time, Duro learns which approaches win for which project types, continuously improving design quality.

origin.context: User evolved workflow: 'Final design should be one side of the aisle, need outcome from other side for head-to-head. Goal: Duro learns what works while producing top-tier designs.'
